subject: Career
title: Structured vs. Unstructured Interviews
description: A fast breakdown of Structured vs. Unstructured Interviews for builders.

hook.text: Unstructured interviews predict job performance about as well as a coin flip.

buildup.text: Research by Schmidt and Hunter showed structured interviews are twice as predictive.

discovery.text: Structured means: same questions, same order, scored against a rubric. It limits bias.

twist.text: Most companies still use unstructured interviews because they 'trust their gut.'

climax.text: As a candidate, you can't change the format. But knowing which type you're in shapes your strategy.

punchline.text: Gut feeling hires are no better than chance.

quiz.question: How do structured interviews compare to unstructured ones?
options: Twice as predictive of job performance
